ie.gmit.dip

Class WordParser

  • java.lang.Object
    • ie.gmit.dip.WordParser
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    APIWordParser

    public class WordParser
extends java.lang.Object
implements APIWordParser
    A class that implements the APIWordParser interface See APIWordParser
    Since:
    1.8

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      WordParser() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addAll(java.lang.String[] words, java.lang.String googleWord)
      Loops over the array and maps each key word to the value passed in by the paramater googleWord and adds them to the TreeMap wordMap
      java.lang.String getGoogleWord(java.lang.String word)
      Returns the String value mapped to the key word passed in as a parameter, if wordMap contains the key, otherwise it returns the word to lower case
      void mapGoogleWord()
      Uses a BufferedReader to read lines from a file containing a list of Google's 1000 most commonly used words in English, maps these 1000 words as key/value pairs in a TreeMap wordMap, converts them to lower case, adds them to a TreeSet wordSet then calls the mapThesaurus method.
      void mapThesaurus()
      Uses a BufferedReader to read lines from a file containing a thesaurus, where each line contains a set of words delimited by commas, and creates a String array of words words for each line.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

        public WordParser()

    • Method Detail

      • mapGoogleWord

        public void mapGoogleWord()
                   throws java.io.IOException
        Uses a BufferedReader to read lines from a file containing a list of Google's 1000 most commonly used words in English, maps these 1000 words as key/value pairs in a TreeMap wordMap, converts them to lower case, adds them to a TreeSet wordSet then calls the mapThesaurus method.
        Specified by:
        mapGoogleWord in interface APIWordParser
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • mapThesaurus

        public void mapThesaurus()
                  throws java.io.IOException
        Uses a BufferedReader to read lines from a file containing a thesaurus, where each line contains a set of words delimited by commas, and creates a String array of words words for each line. The array is looped over and if wordSet doesn't already contain the word, it is assigned to a String variable googleWord, then the addAll method is called, using words and googleWord as parameters.
        Specified by:
        mapThesaurus in interface APIWordParser
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • addAll

        public void addAll(java.lang.String[] words,
                   java.lang.String googleWord)
        Loops over the array and maps each key word to the value passed in by the paramater googleWord and adds them to the TreeMap wordMap
        Specified by:
        addAll in interface APIWordParser
        Parameters:
        words - the array to loop over to get key
        googleWord - the String value to map to the key

      • getGoogleWord

        public java.lang.String getGoogleWord(java.lang.String word)
                               throws java.lang.Throwable
        Returns the String value mapped to the key word passed in as a parameter, if wordMap contains the key, otherwise it returns the word to lower case
        Specified by:
        getGoogleWord in interface APIWordParser
        Parameters:
        word - inputted by the user via a Scanner in the Input class
        Returns:
        returns value mapped to word
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable
